Sentencas: A numerical investigation of cell-to-cell voltage variation is performed by considering the impact of flow distribution and heat transfer on a SOFC stack.
Titulo: A numerical study of cell-to-cell variations in a SOFC stack

Sentencas: The stack model used is based on a one-dimensional co-flow cell model developed in prior work.
Titulo: A numerical study of cell-to-cell variations in a SOFC stack

Sentencas: The influence of radiative heat transfer between the PEN (positive electrode, electrolyte, negative electrode body) and the neighboring separator plates on the temperature distribution is also considered.
Titulo: A numerical study of cell-to-cell variations in a SOFC stack

Sentencas: Variations in cell voltage are attributed to asymmetries in stack geometry (boundary effects) and non-uniformity in flow rates, more particularly, flow thermal capacity.
Titulo: A numerical study of cell-to-cell variations in a SOFC stack

Sentencas: Simulations were done in a parallel computing environment with each cell computed in a separate (CPU) process.
Titulo: A numerical study of cell-to-cell variations in a SOFC stack

Sentencas: This natural decomposition of the fuel cell stack reduced the number of communicated variables thereby improving computational performance.
Titulo: A numerical study of cell-to-cell variations in a SOFC stack

Sentencas: The parallelization scheme implemented utilized a message passing interface (MPI) protocol where cell-to-cell communication is achieved via exchange of temperature and thermal fluxes between neighboring cells.
Titulo: A numerical study of cell-to-cell variations in a SOFC stack
